prologue_1:
In your lifetime you have acquired all. A family, a fortune, a name.

Everything, yet still, nothing.

An endless chase for some sort of fulfillment that eventually, always faded into nothing.

There is nothing left to pursue, nothing to ease your restless soul for another month or two.
prologue_2:
With each passing day, you grow even more aware of your own cosmic insignificance.

Maybe there is something... something to seek after. The only thing left, The Truth.

And you know, you know that if this search doesn't work, nothing will.
prologue_3:
Hushed whispers cloaked by darkness, and a promise for what you seek at all costs.

A purpose.

It was the reason you left everything behind and dove into this sea of secrets, for it was uncertainty that suffocated you the most.
prologue_4:
You are a reader - someone who can derive meaning from mere strokes forming all sorts of peculiar shapes.

Only you can read the ancient scrolls and find the Truth. But the ruins of your creators are suffocating. The stone looks like crying faces and the traps whisper your name sweetly.

For the sake of your own sanity, get out of there as soon as possible.
scroll_1:
Such is the truth and the truth is this:

You are hurting, but be warned, it is here that you will feel the utmost pain.
Your suffering isn't a punishment.
scroll_2:
This is the truth and the truth is so:

You expect "good" things and in your false expectation, weep when "bad" things come.
There are no good and bad things.
Things just are.
scroll_3:
So is the truth and the truth is such:

You have come too far. A glutenous fly drowning in too much honey that no longer tastes as sweet.
Your mind is but a vessel for my world to bleed into.
ending_n: It was always there. Part of you always knew. You knew you shouldn't look, but you had to. You had to. You let go and wonder why you didn't do so sooner. Finally, at peace.
ending_m: There is nothing other than this, now. Big, big eyes stare at you expectantly. Don't they know? They command silently and you obey. You finally see, but it's not you anymore. Nothing remains of that person.
ending_p:
Your mind was not ready.
 Your jaw clenches hard enough to break your teeth as your eyes roll back.

 You need the scroll's knowledge to move forward.
ending_c:
The glass between you is not the only thing separating you.
 You are of two different worlds, you only exist for their momentary entertainment.
 You must end it yourself, and pray to nothing that they will stop torturing you this time.
